features: IN CONTROL COOKWARE: Farberware Smart Control jumbo cooker features a tempered glass lid with an innovative vent in the knob for easy steam release and fewer boil-overs
ENHANCED NONSTICK: Large family pan boasts DiamondMax Nonstick Technology that performs 3X better than traditional nonstick
MADE TO LAST: Durable aluminum pan construction features a trimmed base for quicker, even heat conduction and years of cooking enjoyment
KEEP YOUR COOL: Double riveted, stay-cool jumbo cooker handles make it easy to move one-pan meals from cooktop to oven
COOK WITH CONVENIENCE: Nonstick jumbo cooker with steam vent technology is oven safe to 350 degrees F and dishwasher safe for fast, easy cleanup
NO WORRIES: Farberware Smart Control cookware is backed by a Lifetime Limited Warranty
body.description: Cook safer with fewer boil-overs when cooking with the Farberware Smart Control Nonstick Jumbo Cooker with Helper Handle and Lid. This large durable aluminum family pan features a trimmed base for quicker heat conduction and is finished with DiamondMax nonstick technology that performs 3X better than traditional nonstick. The tempered glass lid boasts an innovative Smart Control steam vent in the knob to help release steam and prevent boil-overs on the cooktop when cooking one-pot meals for the family. This smartly designed cookware is oven safe to 350°F and the premium nonstick effortlessly releases foods and is dishwasher safe for a quick cleanup.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Even heating, easy to clean, glass top w/vent, handles on opposite sides for carrying or giving pan contents a "distributive shake" to spread them in the pan evenly. Its a deep pan. Depth is 3.34in. Can be used for casserole since its deep. Non-stick surface is , well, non-stick - that's all I can say. For nonstick to actually work, your food should make some of its own juices. Pan lets go of contents and the juices with no sticking. Even burned on sauces (in my case Teriyaki sauce) peel off. Mine was pushed off when I placed it under running water. Let me also say that I have not seen an nonstick plan that is completely stick free. A fish filet cooked in the pan - no fat used. began to stick. It was easily removed with a push of a spatula without any or little residue left behind. Impressive! Before use, I washed the pan, let it dry, and then at the first use, I wipe lightly with canola oil, or you can use whatever you want - nor not! I think this is a very good full size pan. Its shape/depth reminds me of a small "wok/frying pan hybrid". Plus, Its got handles that are useful for carrying, and a vented glass top. . I recommend this pan highly - especially if you are a single person like I am, and due to the pandemic, at home cooking, and need a versatile pan such as this. 5 STARS

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent soup pot!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this pot to replace my old pot since the Teflon had started to chip off. The size is perfect for cooking a batch of soup. I also use it to cook pasta when I’m cooking a large amount. Cleans well and seems like it will be durable. Overall great purchase and I would recommend it to others.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good Pan Good Price
reviews.reviewText: I have lowered my standards for non stick pans. I realize I will have to replace them when the coating starts to flake. This time I ordered the Farberware Smart Control Nonstick Jumbo Cooker/Saute pan. I am very pleased with the size and weight of this pan. I was concerned it would be too light but it hasn't dented or dinged with regular use. The handles stay cool and I can lift it easily with the helper handle. It sautes evenly and the lid vents steam well. I have had this pan for several months now, use it several times a week, and I recommend it. I will update if and when the interior begins to disintegrate.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Works good for me but scratches easily. Didn't pay much so I'm not concerned with light scratches.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No stick durable
reviews.reviewText: I bought this a year ago still it’s works 100% as non stick. Used for cooking gravy meat and soups.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding 6qt Pot - A Must-Have for Every Kitchen
reviews.reviewText: First and foremost, the size of this pot is perfect for a variety of cooking needs. Whether I'm preparing a hearty stew, boiling pasta for the whole family, or simmering a flavorful soup, this 6qt pot provides ample space to accommodate large portions without compromising on performance.The build quality is exceptional. The pot is sturdy, with a well-fitting lid that locks in heat and moisture, ensuring optimal cooking results. The heat distribution is even, preventing any hot spots and allowing my dishes to cook uniformly every time.I appreciate the non-stick interior of the pot, as it makes cooking and cleaning a breeze. Even sticky sauces and stubborn food residue easily slide off, requiring minimal effort for a thorough cleanup. This feature is a time-saver and greatly enhances the overall cooking experience.The pot's ergonomic handles provide a secure and comfortable grip, even when the pot is filled with hot liquids. This aspect, coupled with the durable construction, instills confidence and promotes safe handling in the kitchen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I got this pan for a great price, and had high hopes because I have other Farberware products that are fabulous, stainless steel pots and pans I've had for decades and still look new and cook beautifully. I was a bit leery when this pan arrived, it was super lightweight and seemed a bit chintzy. But I've used it a number of times and LOVE it. It cooks perfectly and washes easily. I've washed it in dishwasher several times. Lid is also nice. I haven't used it in oven and maybe never will because it's only rated to a fairly low oven temp.
Good size and non stick. Light in weight so easy to lift
The greatestNon stick.. perfect for everything from burner to ovenEasy grip handlesLove it!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Arrived damaged. Dent on bottom of the pan.

reviews.reviewText: I had high hopes to like this. Because i desperately need a good set of pots n pans. It did work well for 6-7 cooking sessions. But yesterday when i used biggest pot( the first time with the ladle that came with it) it badly scratched its surface. Mind u, i always use a rybber spatula to cook n soft sponge to wash all non stick surfaces. It should have worked fine with a plastic ladle or spatuala but cant understand how it got bruised this bad. The heat distribution is unbalanced too and mostly the food in the middle of the pot tries to stick and rather burn if u dont stir often. Will surely return or throw since cant use a pot that is shedding off.
